meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -

Alright, let's get this paper trail review started! As you can guess from the title, Paper Trail is a puzzle game all about folding and unfolding paper. Now, I know what you're thinking: "Origami? Really? That sounds so... basic." But trust me, friends, this game will fold (heh) your expectations in more ways than one.

First off, let's talk graphics. The art in Paper Trail is straight-up stunning - think hand-drawn illustrations that'll make you feel like you're stepping into a whimsical fairy tale. And the soundtrack? Oh boy, it's as atmospheric and beautiful as the visuals. You might find yourself getting lost in this world (pun intended).

Now, onto those puzzles! They can be a bit tricky to get used to at first, but once you grasp the concept of folding and unfolding paper to solve problems, you'll be hooked. The game does a great job of introducing new mechanics gradually, so you won't feel overwhelmed.

What I love most about Paper Trail is its unique blend of simplicity and depth. On the surface, it seems like a simple puzzle game, but as you delve deeper, you'll discover that there's a lot more to it. The story, while not necessarily groundbreaking, has a certain charm to it, and you'll find yourself invested in Paige's journey.

Of course, no review would be complete without some (gentle) teasing of our fellow critics. I mean, who wouldn't want to give this game 95 points out of 100? That's like giving the entire origami community a collective high-five!

All jokes aside, Paper Trail is an indie gem that's definitely worth checking out if you're a fan of puzzles and whimsical worlds. So go ahead, fold (okay, I'll stop now), and get ready to be charmed by this delightful little game!
